channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NH

item.title: Report X-2023111036
item.description:
Report X-2023111036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: KEENE
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE CALLED TO PRIMARY AND FOUND LEAKING CARDBOARD BOX WITH HAZARDOUS DIAMOND LABELS ON OUTSIDE. RESPONDER BROUGHT PACKAGE TO DMP AND OPENED BOX. RESPONDER FOUND ONE GALLON WAS LEAKING FROM LOOSE CAP. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DMP PROCEDURE.

item.title: Report E-2023110508
item.description:
Report E-2023110508

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: MANCHESTER
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1824 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group (GSSG) to remediate the impacted site. GSSG personnel utilized hand tools to cut up the impacted pallet, and they wiped up all released product with a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads. All spent absorbent pads, the cut-up pallet, the one (1) empty pail, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into the one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110114
item.description:
Report X-2023110114

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: LONDONDERRY
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered outside an unused QA cage at approx. 22:00. Driver had coded the package refused due to damage. This lead me to believe that the driver brought it from his truck to the cage on his own. DescribePack: Inner container(metal pail) is severely dented on one side, bottom of box shows signs of being wet, though not currently. Container also gives off strong scent similar to gasoline. Outer container completely intact other than being wet. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: As soon as it was discovered, package was moved and set inside plastic bags and a salvage drum. We were able to prevent the substance from leaking onto anything in between.
